title: Short Stories Old and New
author: Selected and Edited by C. Alphonso Smith
snippet: Thatwas, for Markheim, the one displeasing circumstance. It carried himback, upon the instant, to a certain fair day in a fisher's village: agray day, a piping wind, a crowd upon the street, the blare of brasses,the booming of drums, the nasal voice of a ballad singer; and a boygoing to and fro, buried over head in the crowd and divided betweeninterest and fear, until, coming out upon the chief place of concourse,he beheld a booth and a great screen with pictures, dismally designed,garishly colored: Brownrigg with her apprentice; the Mannings with theirmurdered guest; Weare in the death-grip of Thurtell; and a score besidesof famous crimes. The thing was as clear as an illusion; he was onceagain that little boy; he was looking once again, and with the samesense of physical revolt, at these vile pictures; he was still stunnedby the thumping of the drums.
